snippet: Ketchum’s staff members who provide public relations advice to Russia must avoid being seen as defending acts contrary to American interests while still providing some luster for a lucrative client.
abstract: Public relations firm Ketchum has found itself walking increasingly fine line as it tries to work with Russia, which hired firm to provide advice on public relations before relations with rest of the world soured; company must avoid being seen as defending acts contrary to American interests but continue to provide some luster for its client.
lead_paragraph: Ketchum’s staff members who provide public relations advice to Russia must avoid being seen as defending acts contrary to American interests while still providing some luster for a lucrative client.

headline.main: P.R. Firm for Putin’s Russia Now Walking a Fine Line
headline.print_headline: P.R. Firm for Putin’s Russia Now Walking a Fine Line
